name: Pediatric Primary Tumor
title: Pediatric Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** Evaluation of primary tumor is based on several factors
* Surgically resected WITH or WITHOUT neoadjuvant therapy and tumor(s) confined to the liver with **negative/unknown** margins 
   - One lobe involved (see code 150)
   - More than one lobe involved (see code 250)
* Surgically resected WITH or WITHOUT neoadjuvant therapy and tumor(s) confined to the liver with **positive** margins (codes 175 and 275)
   - One lobe involved (see code 175)
   - More than one lobe involved (see code 275)
* Partial surgical resection WITH or WITHOUT neoadjuvant therapy, or unresectable and tumor(s) confined to the liver (code 350)

**Note 2:** Direct or contiguous extension to an adjacent structure is collected in Pediatric Mets.
* If the only information available is extension to an adjacent site, code Pediatric Primary Tumor 999. 
* Extension to the following are collected in EOD mets
  * Diaphragm 
  * Extrahepatic bile duct(s) 
  * Extrahepatic blood vessel(s) (hepatic artery, portal vein, vena cava)
  * Ligament(s) (coronary, falciform, hepatoduodenal, hepatogastric, round (of liver), trangular)
  * Gallbladder
  * Major vascular invasion
  * Omentum (lesser and greater)
  * Pancreas
  * Peritoneum, NOS
  * Pleura
  * Stomach
rows:
PATHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT ONLY

Tumor confined to the liver WITH or WITHOUT vascular invasion and NEGATIVE/UNKNOWN surgical margins
* Complete resection of the tumor(s)
* Single lesion (one lobe)
* Multiple (satellite) nodules/tumors confined to one lobe
* Confined to liver, NOS
* Localized, NOS

PATHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT ONLY

Tumor confined to the liver WITH or WITHOUT vascular invasion
* Complete resection of the tumor(s)
* More than one lobe involved by contiguous growth (single lesion)
* Multiple (satellite) nodules/tumors in more than one lobe of liver or on surface of parenchyma

Tumor confined to the liver WITH or WITHOUT vascular invasion
* Incomplete resection done or no surgical resection performed
* Determined to be unresectable 
* Presses onto vital tissues in the liver

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in medical record
Tumor not confined to the liver
Tumor extends beyond the liver

Death Certificate Only
